title: Quick Tree Building
text: PhyInsight package used efficiently conduct DNA sequence analyses. vignette, use package functions order create phylogenetic tree demonstrated. functions package used manipulate DNA strings, remove mismatched strings, remove strings cause distance outliers necessary. processes performed automatically appropriate functions used can save user much time effort.   taxon can used provided DNA strings correct format. Ursidae family used example one can use PhyInsight manipulate DNA strings build phylogenetic tree just four functions specimen dataframe ready.

title: Quick Tree Building
text: Choosing gene region(s) use important step vary depending research question taxa. example, sequences COI-5P region used analysis. Also, getSpeciesRepr() used automatically select representative observations species.
code: # query the data using the taxon name specdata <- querySpecData("Ursidae")  # check the number of DNA marker codes sort(table(specdata$markercode)) #>  #>    16S D-loop    ND1    ND2    ND3    ND4   ND4L  ND5-0    ND6   atp6   COII  #>      4      9     14     14     14     14     14     14     14     39     41  #> COXIII   CYTB COI-5P  #>     41     42    523 # subset results that only have nucleotides from the COI-5P region specdata <- subset(specdata, markercode == "COI-5P")  # get one observation per species specdata <- getSpeciesRepr(specdata)

title: Quick Tree Building
text: , functions package used automatically create DNA bin, create DNA string set object, automatically manipulate strings.
code: # generate a DNA bin DNABin <- genDNABin(specdata)  # use the DNA bin to create a DNA string set DNAStringset <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin)  # automatically manipulate the DNA strings  DNAStringSet <- ManipStringSet(DNAStringset)

title: Quick Tree Building
text: , genPhytree() function used automatically create phylo tree object. labels names, offset, size can also edited.
code: # automatically generate a phylo tree PhyloTree <- genPhytree(DNAStringSet)   # change the label names PhyloTree$tip.label <- paste(specdata$genus_name, "|", specdata$species_name)

title: Quick Tree Building
code: # plot the phylo tree plot(   PhyloTree,   label.offset = 0.001,   cex = 1.5 )

title: Automated String Clean Up
text: rmBadStrings functions (rmBadStrings_1(), rmBadStrings_2(), rmBadStrings_3()) can used automatically clean DNA string set otherwise unsuitable analysis. functions use slightly different methods automatically remove strings mismatched others whose distances return NaN values considered outliers.

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: # query the data using the taxon name specdata <- querySpecData("Nepenthes")  # subset results that only have nucleotides from the matK region specdata <- subset(specdata, markercode == "matK")  # get one observation per species specdata <- getSpeciesRepr(specdata)

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: # generate a DNA bin DNABin <- genDNABin(specdata)  # use the DNA bin to create a DNA string set DNAStringset <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin)  # automatically manipulate the DNA strings  DNAStringSet_manip <- ManipStringSet(DNAStringset)

title: Automated String Clean Up
text: point attempting create phylo tree result error. Using DECIPHER::BrowseSeqs(DNAStringSet_manip) view string set reveal series mismatched fragmented strings. Using rmBadStrings_1() automatically remove mismatched strings. , tree can created plotted.
code: # use the function to remove unsuitable strings and store into an object BadStringsRemoved <- rmBadStrings_1(   DNAStringSet = DNAStringSet_manip,   specimen_dataframe = specdata )

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: DNAStringSet_new <- BadStringsRemoved[[1]] specdata_new <- BadStringsRemoved[[2]]

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: # automatically generate a phylo tree PhyloTree <- genPhytree(DNAStringSet_new)  # change the label names PhyloTree$tip.label <- specdata_new$species_name  # plot the phylo tree plot(   PhyloTree,   label.offset = 0.0001,   cex = 1 )

title: Automated String Clean Up
text: rmBadStrings functions also optional arguments remove strings whose DNA distances considered outliers. rmOutliers logical argument set TRUE automatically remove outliers well performing regular processes. max_Z_score numerical value allows user change maximum Z score string’s DNA distance. default value argument 3 score higher generally considered outlier.

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: # use the function to remove unsuitable strings and remove outliers BadStringsRemoved <- rmBadStrings_1(   DNAStringSet = DNAStringSet_manip,   specimen_dataframe = specdata,      rmOutliers = TRUE ) #> [1] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  58"

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: DNAStringSet_new <- BadStringsRemoved[[1]] specdata_new <- BadStringsRemoved[[2]]

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: # automatically generate a phylo tree PhyloTree <- genPhytree(DNAStringSet_new)  # change the label names PhyloTree$tip.label <- specdata_new$species_name  # plot the phylo tree plot(   PhyloTree,   label.offset = 0.0001,   cex = 1 )

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: # use the function to remove unsuitable strings and remove outliers BadStringsRemoved <- rmBadStrings_1(   DNAStringSet = DNAStringSet_manip,   specimen_dataframe = specdata,      rmOutliers = TRUE,      max_Z_score = 2 ) #> [1] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  58" #> [1] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  8"  #> [2] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  17" #> [3] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  20" #> [4] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  27" #> [5] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  28" #> [6] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  48" #> [7] detected and removed:  3"  #>  [2] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  7"  #>  [3] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  11" #>  [4] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  13" #>  [5] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  27" #>  [6] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  33" #>  [7] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  34" #>  [8] "Outlier strings detected and removed:  36" #>  [9] title: Automated String Clean Up
code: DNAStringSet_new <- BadStringsRemoved[[1]] specdata_new <- BadStringsRemoved[[2]]

title: Automated String Clean Up
code: # automatically generate a phylo tree PhyloTree <- genPhytree(DNAStringSet_new)  # change the label names PhyloTree$tip.label <- specdata_new$species_name  # plot the phylo tree plot(   PhyloTree,   label.offset = 0.0001,   cex = 1 )

title: Authors and Citation
text: James Churchward. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Churchward J (2023). PhyInsight: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation. R package version 0.1.0, https://jamesc845.github.io/PhyInsight/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PhyInsight: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation},   author = {James Churchward},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://jamesc845.github.io/PhyInsight/}, }

what: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation
title: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation
text: Welcome PhyInsight, tool showing phylogenetic insights automatic DNA string manipulation. Currently, functions suitable querying, manipulating, analysing data Bold System database. However, features added future.

title: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation
text: PhyInsight functions : retrieve specimen data organises easy--use dataframe automatically process DNA strings preparing analysis filter mismatched sequences detect remove outlier sequences create, plot, save phylogenetic trees

title: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation
text: can install PhyInsight 0.1.0 GitHub using following command:
code: remotes::install_github("JamesC845/PhyInsight")

title: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation
text: functions automatic phylogenetic tree inference added functions added /existing functions updated PhyInsight compatible databases functions added automatic querying, writing & reading FASTA files

title: DNA Sequence Analysis & Generation Tree Creation
text: kind feedback new upcoming R package welcome. Whether suggestions specific research applications, ideas new functions, constructive criticism improve package’s functionality, thoughts highly appreciated. Please don’t hesitate get contact share feedback via email jameschurchward1@outlook.com.

title: Manipulate String Set — ManipStringSet
text: Orient align DNA sequences DNA string set object.

title: Manipulate String Set — ManipStringSet
code: ManipStringSet(DNAStringSet)

title: Manipulate String Set — ManipStringSet
text: DNAStringSet DNA string set object.

title: Manipulate String Set — ManipStringSet
text: DNA string set (ready analysis)

title: Manipulate String Set — ManipStringSet
code: # generate and manipulate a DNA string set object using the taxon 'Antheraea polyphemus' specdf_Anth <- querySpecData("Antheraea polyphemus")[1:10,]  DNABin_Anth <- genDNABin(specdf_Anth)  DNAStringset_Anth <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin_Anth)  DNAStringSet_Anth_manipulated <- ManipStringSet(DNAStringset_Anth) #> ======================================================================================================================================================================================================== #>  #> Time difference of 0.04 secs #> Determining distance matrix based on shared 9-mers: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Clustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Aligning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.04 secs #>  #> Iteration 1 of 2: #>  #> Determining distance matrix based on alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Reclustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Realigning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.03 secs #>  #> Alignment converged - skipping remaining iteration. #>

title: Generate a DNA Bin — genDNABin
text: Create DNA bin object using specimen dataframe.

title: Generate a DNA Bin — genDNABin
code: genDNABin(specimen_dataframe)

title: Generate a DNA Bin — genDNABin
text: specimen_dataframe dataframe specimen data created using querySpecData()

title: Generate a DNA Bin — genDNABin
text: DNA bin object.

title: Generate a DNA Bin — genDNABin
code: # generate a DNA bin object using the taxon 'Antheraea polyphemus' specdf_Anth <- querySpecData("Antheraea polyphemus")[1:10,]  DNABin_Anth <- genDNABin(specdf_Anth)

what: Generate a DNA String Set — genDNAStringSet
title: Generate a DNA String Set — genDNAStringSet
text: Create DNA string set object using DNA bin object write read FASTA file.

title: Generate a DNA String Set — genDNAStringSet
code: genDNAStringSet(DNABin)

title: Generate a DNA String Set — genDNAStringSet
text: DNABin DNA bin object.

title: Generate a DNA String Set — genDNAStringSet
text: DNA string set

title: Generate a DNA String Set — genDNAStringSet
code: # generate a DNA string set object using the taxon 'Antheraea polyphemus' specdf_Anth <- querySpecData("Antheraea polyphemus")[1:10,]  DNABin_Anth <- genDNABin(specdf_Anth)  DNAStringset_Anth <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin_Anth)

what: Create a Phylogenetic Tree Object — genPhytree
title: Create a Phylogenetic Tree Object — genPhytree
text: Create phylo tree object using manipulated DNA string set object.

title: Create a Phylogenetic Tree Object — genPhytree
code: genPhytree(manipulated_stringset, incompleteDist = TRUE)

title: Create a Phylogenetic Tree Object — genPhytree
text: manipulated_stringset manipulated string set object. incompleteDist logical value state whether create tree incomplete distances.

title: Create a Phylogenetic Tree Object — genPhytree
text: phylogenetic tree object

title: Create a Phylogenetic Tree Object — genPhytree
code: # create and plot a phylo tree specdf_Anth <- querySpecData("Antheraea polyphemus")[1:10,]  DNABin_Anth <- genDNABin(specdf_Anth)  DNAStringset_Anth <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin_Anth)  DNAStringSet_Anth_manipulated <- ManipStringSet(DNAStringset_Anth) #> ======================================================================================================================================================================================================== #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #> Determining distance matrix based on shared 9-mers: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Clustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Aligning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.03 secs #>  #> Iteration 1 of 2: #>  #> Determining distance matrix based on alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Reclustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Realigning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.03 secs #>  #> Alignment converged - skipping remaining iteration. #>   Phytree_Anth <- genPhytree(DNAStringSet_Anth_manipulated)  Phytree_Anth$edge.length <- Phytree_Anth$edge.length + (mean(Phytree_Anth$edge.length) * 0.1)  plot(Phytree_Anth)

title: Get Genus Representatives — getGenusRepr
text: Get one observation/row per genus specimen dataframe.

title: Get Genus Representatives — getGenusRepr
code: getGenusRepr(specimen_dataframe)

title: Get Genus Representatives — getGenusRepr
text: specimen_dataframe specimen dataframe.

title: Get Genus Representatives — getGenusRepr
text: dataframe column pertains variable row individual specimen.

title: Get Genus Representatives — getGenusRepr
code: # query data then extract one observation for each of the genera available specdata <- querySpecData("Alouatta")  specdata <- getGenusRepr(specdata)

title: Get Species Representatives — getSpeciesRepr
text: Get one observation/row per species specimen dataframe.

title: Get Species Representatives — getSpeciesRepr
code: getSpeciesRepr(specimen_dataframe)

title: Get Species Representatives — getSpeciesRepr
text: specimen_dataframe specimen dataframe.

title: Get Species Representatives — getSpeciesRepr
text: dataframe column pertains variable row individual specimen.

title: Get Species Representatives — getSpeciesRepr
code: # query data then extract one observation for each of the species available specdata <- PhyInsight::querySpecData("Alouatta")  specdata <- getSpeciesRepr(specdata)

title: Query Specimen Data — querySpecData
text: Get specimen DNA sequence data Bold Systems database returned dataframe.

title: Query Specimen Data — querySpecData
code: querySpecData(taxonName)

title: Query Specimen Data — querySpecData
text: taxonName character string scientific name chosen taxon.

title: Query Specimen Data — querySpecData
text: dataframe column pertains variable row individual specimen.

title: Query Specimen Data — querySpecData
code: # generate a specimen data frame using the taxon 'Antheraea polyphemus' specdf_Anth <- querySpecData("Antheraea polyphemus")[1:10,]

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_1
text: Identify remove bad DNA sequences within string set. Prioritise removal smallest base width first.

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_1
code: rmBadStrings_1(   DNAStringSet,   specimen_dataframe,   rmOutliers = FALSE,   max_Z_score = 3 )

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_1
text: DNAStringSet DNA string set object. specimen_dataframe dataframe speciment data created using querySpecData(). rmOutliers logical value state whether remove DNA distance outlier strings max_Z_score numerical value change max Z score removing outliers.

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_1
text: list two elements: DNA string set mismatched sequences removed (1st element) specimen dataframe data mismatched sequences removed (2nd element).

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_1
code: # remove problem strings from a DNA string set specdata <- querySpecData("Panthera leo")  specdata <- subset(specdata, markercode == "COI-5P")  DNABin_Leo <- genDNABin(specdata)  DNAStringset_Leo <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin_Leo)  DNAStringSet_Leo_manipulated <- ManipStringSet(DNAStringset_Leo) #> ======================================================================================================================================================================================================== #>  #> Time difference of 0.03 secs #> Determining distance matrix based on shared 9-mers: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Clustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Aligning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.37 secs #>  #> Iteration 1 of 2: #>  #> Determining distance matrix based on alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Reclustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Realigning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.17 secs #>  #> Iteration 2 of 2: #>  #> Determining distance matrix based on alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Reclustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Realigning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Refining the alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.08 secs #>   StringsAndSpecdataframe <- rmBadStrings_1(   DNAStringSet = DNAStringSet_Leo_manipulated,  specimen_dataframe = specdata  )  DNAStringSet_NEW <- StringsAndSpecdataframe[[1]]  tail(DNAStringSet_NEW) #> DNAStringSet object of length 6: #>     width seq                                               names                #> [1]  1551 ATTTTACCTATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCTACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 35 #> [2]  1551 ---------ATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCAACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 36 #> [3]  1551 -----------------------...----------------------- 37 #> [4]  1551 ATTTTACCTATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCTACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 38 #> [5]  1551 ---------ATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCAACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 39 #> [6]  1551 ATTTTACCTATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCTACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 40  specimen_dataframe_NEW <- StringsAndSpecdataframe[[2]]  tail(specimen_dataframe_NEW$processid) #> [1] "GBMNA13468-19" "GBMNA13472-19" "GBMNC75139-20" "GBMTG2630-16"  #> [5] "GBMTG5733-16"  "GENG056-12"

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_2
text: Identify remove bad DNA sequences within string set. Sequentially removes mismatches sequences align.

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_2
code: rmBadStrings_2(   DNAStringSet,   specimen_dataframe,   rmOutliers = FALSE,   max_Z_score = 3 )

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_2
text: DNAStringSet DNA string set object. specimen_dataframe dataframe speciment data created using querySpecData(). rmOutliers logical value state whether remove DNA distance outlier strings max_Z_score numerical value change max Z score removing outliers.

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_2
text: list two elements: DNA string set mismatched sequences removed (1st element) specimen dataframe data mismatched sequences removed (2nd element).

title: Remove Mismatched DNA Sequences — rmBadStrings_2
code: # remove problem strings from a DNA string set specdata <- querySpecData("Panthera leo")  specdata <- subset(specdata, markercode == "COI-5P")  DNABin_Leo <- genDNABin(specdata)  DNAStringset_Leo <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin_Leo)  DNAStringSet_Leo_manipulated <- ManipStringSet(DNAStringset_Leo) #> ======================================================================================================================================================================================================== #>  #> Time difference of 0.03 secs #> Determining distance matrix based on shared 9-mers: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Clustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Aligning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.37 secs #>  #> Iteration 1 of 2: #>  #> Determining distance matrix based on alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Reclustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Realigning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.17 secs #>  #> Iteration 2 of 2: #>  #> Determining distance matrix based on alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Reclustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Realigning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #>  #> Refining the alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.08 secs #>   StringsAndSpecdataframe <- rmBadStrings_2(   DNAStringSet = DNAStringSet_Leo_manipulated,  specimen_dataframe = specdata  )  DNAStringSet_NEW <- StringsAndSpecdataframe[[1]]  tail(DNAStringSet_NEW) #> DNAStringSet object of length 6: #>     width seq                                               names                #> [1]  1551 -----------------------...----------------------- 37 #> [2]  1551 ATTTTACCTATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCTACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 38 #> [3]  1551 ---------ATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCAACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 39 #> [4]  1551 ATTTTACCTATGTTCATAAACCG...AACCTACCTATGTGTTGCTAAAA 40 #> [5]  1551 -----------------------...----------------------- 41 #> [6]  1551 -----------------------...----------------------- 42  specimen_dataframe_NEW <- StringsAndSpecdataframe[[2]]  tail(specimen_dataframe_NEW$processid) #> [1] "GBMNC75139-20" "GBMTG2630-16"  "GBMTG5733-16"  "GENG056-12"    #> [5] "LAB008-23"     "ZOOZS027-23"

what: Save a Phylogenetic Tree Object — savePhytree
title: Save a Phylogenetic Tree Object — savePhytree
text: Create phylogenetic tree PDF using phylo tree object specimen dataframe.

title: Save a Phylogenetic Tree Object — savePhytree
code: savePhytree(   phyloTree,   specimen_dataframe,   label_offset = 5.5e-05,   label_size = 0.3,   tree_file_name = "Phylogenetic_Tree.pdf",   openPDF = FALSE,   savePDF = FALSE )

title: Save a Phylogenetic Tree Object — savePhytree
text: phyloTree phylo tree object. specimen_dataframe specimen dataframe. label_offset numerical value set label offset distance. label_size numerical value set label size. tree_file_name optional character string name PDF file. openPDF logical value state whether open PDF file. savePDF logical value state whether save PDF file working directory. FALSE file saved temporary directory still able open.

title: Save a Phylogenetic Tree Object — savePhytree
text: PDF file.

title: Save a Phylogenetic Tree Object — savePhytree
code: # create and plot a phylo tree specdf_Anth <- querySpecData("Antheraea polyphemus")[1:10,]  DNABin_Anth <- genDNABin(specdf_Anth)  DNAStringset_Anth <- genDNAStringSet(DNABin_Anth)  DNAStringSet_Anth_manipulated <- ManipStringSet(DNAStringset_Anth) #> ======================================================================================================================================================================================================== #>  #> Time difference of 0.01 secs #> Determining distance matrix based on shared 9-mers: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Clustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Aligning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.03 secs #>  #> Iteration 1 of 2: #>  #> Determining distance matrix based on alignment: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Reclustering into groups by similarity: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0 secs #>  #> Realigning Sequences: #> ================================================================================ #>  #> Time difference of 0.03 secs #>  #> Alignment converged - skipping remaining iteration. #>   Phytree_Anth <- genPhytree(DNAStringSet_Anth_manipulated)  savePhytree(  phyloTree = Phytree_Anth,  specimen_dataframe = specdf_Anth,  tree_file_name = "Anth_phylo_tree.pdf",  openPDF = FALSE,  savePDF = FALSE )
